title: AntiBabylon 2022 | Georgia
excerpt: AntiBabylon 2022 - Georgian event: 15.11., 19:00, Goethe-Institut Georgien | Zandukeli Str. 16, 0108 Tbilisi
description: Poets from five countries ‚Äî Armenia, Georgia, Moldova, Ukraine and Germany ‚Äî are taking part in the project. The aim of the antiBabylon 2022 project is to create a free multilingual poetic space - with a horizontal structure and an inherently international component. Essential is the comprehension of a unique linguistic identity which does not divide, but unites as well as an anti-imperialist state of mind. The project is organized by the Berlin-based international NGO PANDA platforma with the support of the German Foreign Office and takes place in cooperation with local partner organizations, such as Goethe Institut im Exil. Partner countries: Georgia, Armenia, Moldova, Ukraine and Germany This event is a part of the creative tour of the project team. During this event, the results of a 1 month multilingual poetry lab will be presented, with the selected participants and jury members from the five countries, this time with an emphasis on Georgian language. Prepare to dive into an evening full of spoken word and performance poetry flowing between languages, countries and stories.

title: AntiBabylon 2022 | Ukraine - Livestream
excerpt: Livestream for those who cannot attend the event in person
description:
The Ukrainian AntiBabylon 2022 event had to take place in Kyiw, Ukraine, which is obviously and unfortunately not possible this year due to the brutal Russian war and constant terrorist attacks on this country. Thanks to ACUD MACHT NEU in Berlin for welcoming our free multilingual poetic space this time, with the kind support of Goethe Institut im Exil.

Livestream link:

https://panda-platforma.berlin/antibabylon-ua

title: AntiBabylon 2022 | Final event BERLIN
description:
Last day of AntiBabylon 2022!

Young poets from Georgia, Armenia, Moldova, Ukraine and Germany are reading each other's poems in their mother tongues:
  • - Tatev Chakhian reads Mariia Chuprynenko
  • - Andro Dadiani reads Dumitru Fanfarov
  • - Mariia Chuprynenko reads Josefine Berkholz
  • - Josefine Berkholz and Dumitru Fanfarov read Andro Dadiani
  • - all together reading ‚ÄúMigrant point‚Äù by Tatev Chakhian


‚ûï special guests from Berlin:

* Deenara Rasuleva with her Tatar & multilingual poems
* Alexandr Delphinov with a poem auf Deutsch.

PHOTOS BY Roman Ekimov
